intro: Galeopsis pallens, commonly known as the slender hedge nettle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and basil. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its small, pale blue or white flowers are arranged in whorled clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Galeopsis pallens is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
